description.narrative: By 2024, the early childhood and basic education subsectors have the capacity to reduce the number of out-of-school children, and to improve enrolment, retention and completion through delivering quality, equitable, learner- and gender-sensitive pedagogy for all children including adolescents

mailing-address.narrative: Sekou Toure Avenue Mamba Point Monrovia

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of secondary education teacher training
Provision of training of other education staff excluding teachers (e.g. inspectors, district, ministry staff, etc.)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 2550/A0/09/882 OUTCOME 2:. EARLY LEARNING AND BASIC EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, the early childhood and basic education subsectors have the capacity to reduce the number of out-of-school children, and to improve enrolment, retention and completion through delivering quality, equitable, learner- and gender-sensitive pedagogy for all children including adolescents

description.narrative: By August 2020,1,500 school administartors,126 DEOs and 2,774 teachers (556 female) in 965 schools (637 public, 328 private) acquired knowledge and skills on child-centered and gender responsive pedagogy. An additional 1,000 subject specialists were trained and provided with tips on how to monitor and evaluate distance learning during the COVID-19 pandemic pedagogy. An additional 1,000 subject specialists were trained and provided with tips on how to monitor and evaluate distance learning during the COVID-19 pandemic. UNICEF Supported the collection of data for the annual school census 2019/2020 from 6426 schools to be feed into the Education Management Information System (EMIS). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Teachers - Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
Number of adolescent girls and boys with improved learning outcome results in 4 core subjects
Service Delivery - Gender - Number of schools supported by UNICEF with interventions targeting specifically girls (e.g. segregated toilets, sanitary pads, MHM, etc.)
Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
Service Delivery - Teachers - Lower secondary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
